data.title: freetype font label has some noise pixel
data.body:
after update today, the freetype font label seems made a little broken: there are some noise pixels at the top or bottom randomly.

![a](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5842874/9427921/cad6c988-49c7-11e5-9a5b-6d3c0c980143.png)

data.title: CheckButton size problem
data.body:
the frontCross part will scale itself to the "_contentSize" when show 
( see in: 
void AbstractCheckButton::frontCrossTextureScaleChangedWithSize()
)
and change to "_backgroundTextureScaleX/Y" when hide
( see in:
void AbstractCheckButton::onPressStateChangedToNormal()
)

it will cause problem if we use a texutre smaller than the background part:
1. the frontCross texture is scaled without real need.
2. the frontCross will show as a bigger size at first ( scaled to content size ), but if we click to unselect it and then select it again by "setSelected" call instead of actually clicking, it will show as a smaller(normal) size finally. because when deselect by click, it has scaled to  "_backgroundTextureScaleX/Y"(almost 1.0f),  but "setSelected" call won't active the SizeChange notify for recovery.

adivse:
why use two parts for a checkbox (front and background) ? one is enough, we can make a background image with a cross and another one without, just as normal button. the frontCross part is so small and has litte value for reuse, but increase the complexity.

data.title: Ending AudioEngine in Win32 causes a "std::system_exception"
need to rename AVAudioPlayer to avoid conflicting with system framework: AVFoundation.framework
data.body:
cocos2d-x team,

Please rename your version of AVAudioPlayer to CCAVAudioPlayer, to avoid conflicting with the version of AVAudioPlayer in the system framework : AVFoundation.framework . This is easily reproducible by doing a Mac build.

After a successful Mac build, when you run the newly built Mac app, the following warning message appears:
Class AVAudioPlayer is implemented in both /System/Library/Frameworks/AVFoundation.framework/Versions/A/Resources/libAVFAudio.dylib and [the newly built desktop app].. One of the two will be used. Which one is undefined.

From looking at the cocos2d-x source code, it's implementing the class AVAudioPlayer. The conflict must be occurring because AVFoundation.framework must also be definining it's _own_ AVAudioPlayer\* class. 

```
cocos/audio/mac/CDXMacOSXSupport.h
26: A set of proxy classes to allow iOS audio code to run on MacOS X. AVAudioPlayer is implemented using NSSound.
30: AVAudioPlayer numberOfLoops not correctly supported.  Looping is either on or off, can not specify a specific number of loops.
31: AVAudioPlayer panning not supported.
32: AVAudioPlayer metering not supported.
57: Based on AVAudioPlayer.h header in AVFoundation headers
60:@protocol AVAudioPlayerDelegate;
63:@interface AVAudioPlayer : NSObject <NSSoundDelegate> {
```

data.title: RenderTexture problem with Clang 3.6.1 on Linux Ubuntu
data.body:
I tried to use RenderTexture with Clang 3.6.1 on Ubuntu 14.04, got error when calling 

renderTexture->end()

Works fine on GCC 4.9

data.body:
This PR adds the missing CCCameraBackgroundBrush files to the Win10 UWP libcocos2d project.
This PR also fixes winrt paused audio issue issue https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/issues/13254
Added running tests section for Windows 10 UWP apps in ReadMe.

data.title: Strange behaviour of Scene in Cocos2d-x 3.6
[3.8] ListView has rendering bug when calling setScrollBarAutoHideEnabled(false)

milestone.title: v3.8
milestone.description:
This version is planned to only "fix existing bugs" and "unfinished tasks".
We need to improve the quality after a 3D rush in v3.6 and v3.7.

data.body:
When calling `setScrollBarAutoHideEnabled(false)`, ListView doesnt shows the scrollbar right away, instead its showing the scrollbars circle in the bottom left corner. This goes away when scrolling because then the real scrollbar becomes visible on the right side.

![artifact](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4009589/9406244/f44a7104-47fe-11e5-9386-db4b1096306b.PNG)
![res](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4009589/9412878/b66acf02-482e-11e5-94f2-f861c2f3ccfc.PNG)

data.title: Support pixelate effect
data.body:
Some game may need not blurring canvas image while resizing it, for example some retro games.

Solution: 
- http://stackoverflow.com/questions/18547042/resizing-a-canvas-image-without-blurring-it
- http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7615009/disable-interpolation-when-scaling-a-canvas

It may be happened when visit() called manually for a reason such as to perform render-to-texture.

data.title: TMX, vertical camera cull not working properly
data.body:
Only horizontal parallax seems to be working properly, and it seems that it takes in consideration only design size from the origin. 

The first map works fine but after scrolling down the camera culls everything but sprites, the second map starts a bit down from the origin and it simply does not render at all. If we move forward only sprites are rendered.

First map:
![parallax1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8097385/9401562/95a7c306-478e-11e5-84ff-7f9f85e403c7.PNG)
![parallax2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8097385/9401555/953a4268-478e-11e5-88e6-da9d4eac417c.PNG)
![parallax3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8097385/9401557/9545d966-478e-11e5-9a15-0a1d9d59edbb.PNG)
![tmx](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8097385/9401556/953f8a98-478e-11e5-8ec1-d822eb7aadcd.PNG)

Second map:
![night1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8097385/9401559/9556715e-478e-11e5-8584-5b0da2efb090.PNG)
![night2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8097385/9401558/954f44b0-478e-11e5-81b1-ecf8fb6a9a1e.PNG)
![night3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8097385/9401560/9572bed6-478e-11e5-8a16-91fcadf9295b.PNG)
